item.title: Operating Akkoma
item.description: A couple of months into self-hosting my Akkoma instance, I find myself doing a couple of operational tasks at a recurring basis. So might as well write them down here for future reference. Again, this is on my ARM-based machine with Ubuntu 22.04, where Akkoma is installed from source. Backing Up (Periodically) The doc’s backup instructions essentially says we should back up the database, plus a couple of configs and static files/directories.

item.title: Installing an Akkoma Instance
item.description: I’ve decided to self-host my own Akkoma (a hard fork of Pleroma) instance, after actively and happily using Mastodon for 2.5 years. Inspired by The Teabag Ninja’s awesome and detailed writeup on Akkoma’s OTP install, I’m also sharing my source installation notes along the way for all the folks on the internet, including my future self – since I did have a few surprises during the process. Unless otherwise noted, all commands below are tested on an ARM-based machine with Ubuntu 22.
